result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad J Mattson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Attorney Fees To Be Determined. 
Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.

records.addlTxt:
10:46 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Chad J Mattson in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Chad J Mattson.
Covers 22CM9, 21CF399, 21TR1830 and  21TR1826

21CF399, 21TR1830 and 21TR1826 - Adjourned to original date before Judge Babler on July 15, 2022 at 10:00 a.m.


22CM9 Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  Guilty plea entered to Counts 1 and 2.  Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  State relates.  Attorney Rockow relates.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

Counts 1 and 2:
Court costs - 60 DTP
Order for DNA given to defendant in court.  Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.

10:50 AM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Chad J Mattson in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Chad J Mattson. 

Atty. Rockow asks for plea hearing to be set; Court grants.
Bond to continue.
Plea hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

8:45 AM THIS COVERS 21CF399, 21TR1826, 21TR1830, 22CM9.
Defendant Chad J Mattson appeared in court, Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Chad J Mattson.  ADA Julie Matucheski appeared for State of WI    8:45  Officer Torey Belich with Rice Lake  PD by zoom video called, sworn and direct by State. Witness identified the defendant.  No cross by Attorney Rockow.     Court finds probable cause and binds over. 
Police still have his telephone.

22CM09  Judge Boyle   4-13-2022 @ 10:00.
Arraignment scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

10:21 AM Defendant Chad J Mattson in court with attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court.  Brian H. Wright appeared for the State of Wisconsin in court.
COVERS 21CF399, 22CM9, 21TR1826 & 21TR1830.
21CF399 - Time limits waived.  Preliminary Hearing set for 02/10/22 @ 8:45 a.m.  May appear by Zoom video or in person.  Address and phone number confirmed.
22CM9 - Formal reading of Complaint waived.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Phone number provided.  Address confirmed.  
Citations to track.  Hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 08:45 am.
